A Song<S>7892</S> of degrees<S>4609</S>. In my distress<S>6869</S> I cried<S>7121</S> unto the LORD<S>3068</S>, and he heard<S>6030</S> me.
Deliver<S>5337</S> my soul<S>5315</S>, O LORD<S>3068</S>, from lying<S>8267</S> lips<S>8193</S>, and from a deceitful<S>7423</S> tongue<S>3956</S>.
What shall be given<S>5414</S> unto thee? or what shall be done<S>3254</S> unto thee, thou false<S>7423</S> tongue<S>3956</S>? <sup>What shall be given: or, What shall the deceitful tongue give unto thee? or, what shall is profit thee?</sup> <sup>done: Heb. added</sup>
Sharp<S>8150</S> arrows<S>2671</S> of the mighty<S>1368</S>, with coals<S>1513</S> of juniper<S>7574</S>. <sup>Sharp: or, It is as the sharp arrows of the mighty man, with coals of juniper</sup>
Woe<S>190</S> is me, that I sojourn<S>1481</S> in Mesech<S>4902</S>, that I dwell<S>7931</S> in the tents<S>168</S> of Kedar<S>6938</S>!
My soul<S>5315</S> hath long<S>7227</S> dwelt<S>7931</S> with him that hateth<S>8130</S> peace<S>7965</S>.
I am for peace<S>7965</S>: but when I speak<S>1696</S>, they are for war<S>4421</S>. <sup>for peace: or, a man of peace</sup>
